findings.lower_chest: Mild bibasilar atelectasis of the partially imaged lungs. No pleural effusion. A trace, tiny physiologic pericardial fluid.

abdomen.hepatobiliary: Focal hypodensity in the region of the porta hepatis likely represents focal fat. No concerning focal hepatic lesion. Small benign calcification abutting the right hepatic dome. No biliary ductal dilatation, gallbladder abnormality, or ascites.
abdomen.pancreas: 1-cm benign focal fat in the uncinate. Remaining pancreatic parenchyma is normal.
abdomen.spleen: Normal in size and attenuation. A splenule is noted in the left upper quadrant.
abdomen.urinary: Normal sized kidneys with normal nephrograms. Tiny hypodensities in the cortex of the left upper renal pole likely represent cysts. Bladder is moderately distended.
abdomen.gastrointestinal: Small hiatal hernia. Dilated appendix with wall thickening and mucosal enhancement, measuring approximately 12 mm in diameter, with adjacent fat stranding.
abdomen.vascular: No abdominal aortic aneurysm. Minimal calcium burden in abdominal aorta and great abdominal arteries.
abdomen.pelvis: No pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy. No free fluid in the pelvis.

findings.bones_and_soft_tissues: No suspicious lytic or sclerotic bony abnormality. Abdominal and pelvic walls are normal.
